Package com.atakmap.map.layer

Class MultiLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.map.layer.AbstractLayer
      • com.atakmap.map.layer.MultiLayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Layer, Layer2
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LayerBinLayer
    public class MultiLayer
extends AbstractLayer
    A layer composed of zero or more child layers. Child layers may be programmatically added, removed and reordered.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  MultiLayer.OnLayersChangedListener
      Callback interface to provide notification on programmatic modification of the layer stack.

    • Method Detail

      • addLayer

        public void addLayer​(Layer layer)
        Adds the specified layer.
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer to be added

      • addLayer

        public void addLayer​(int position,
                     Layer layer)
        Adds the specified layer at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        position - The position. A position of 0 is the bottom of the stack (will be rendered first); a position of getNumLayers() is the top of the stack (will be rendered last.
        layer - The layer to be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is less than 0 or greater than getNumLayers().

      • addLayerNoSync

      • removeAllLayers

        public void removeAllLayers()
        Removes all layers.

      • setLayerPosition

        public void setLayerPosition​(Layer layer,
                             int position)
        Sets the position of the layer in the stack. A position of 0 is the bottom of the stack (will be rendered first); a position of getNumLayers() - 1 is the top of the stack (will be rendered last.
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer
        position - The index
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to getNumLayers().

      • getNumLayers

        public int getNumLayers()
        Returns the number of layers in the stack.
        Returns:
        The number of layers

      • getLayer

        public Layer getLayer​(int i)
        Returns the layer at the specified position in the stack.
        Parameters:
        i - The index
        Returns:
        The layer at the specified index in the stack.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to getNumLayers().

      • getLayers

        public java.util.List<Layer> getLayers()
        Returns the current layer stack. Modification of the List returned will not result in modification of the actual layer stack.
        Returns:
        The current layer stack.

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible​(boolean visible)
        Description copied from interface: Layer
        Sets the visibility of the layer. Any registered Layer.OnLayerVisibleChangedListener instances should be notified if the visibility of the layer changes as a result of the invocation of this method.
        Specified by:
        setVisible in interface Layer
        Overrides:
        setVisible in class AbstractLayer
        Parameters:
        visible - true to make the layer visible, false to make it invisible.
